content:
Diagnosis:		Pancreatic adenocarcinoma (mucinous type)

Management:		Diagnosed following investigation of obstructive jaundice
			ERCP and stent insertion 15 Apr 2024
			EUS-guided biopsy 18 Apr 2024

Histology:		Mucinous adenocarcinoma of pancreatic head
			BRCA2 pathogenic variant detected

Current situation:	For consideration of neo-adjuvant FOLFIRINOX chemotherapy

[redacted name] is a 62-year-old gentleman who presented with painless jaundice and 4kg weight loss over 2 months. CT pancreas showed a 3.2cm mass in the pancreatic head with no evidence of metastatic disease. CA19-9 was elevated at 850. Following successful biliary stenting and tissue diagnosis, his liver function has normalized and performance status is 1. No significant comorbidities apart from well-controlled hypertension on ramipril. Lives with wife and continues to work part-time as an accountant. On examination today, mild epigastric tenderness but no other significant findings. Given his good performance status and BRCA2 mutation status, I have recommended neo-adjuvant FOLFIRINOX chemotherapy. He will require PICC line insertion and baseline cardiac echo before commencing treatment.

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows 3.2cm pancreatic head mass, no metastatic disease
ERCP and stent insertion for obstructive jaundice

patient_facts.value: Continues to work part-time as accountant

status_updates.value: Newly diagnosed pancreatic head adenocarcinoma. Successfully stented for biliary obstruction, now suitable for neo-adjuvant chemotherapy
Liver function normalized following biliary stenting
Requires PICC line insertion and baseline cardiac echo
